content: Jim Jeffords of Vermont is gone, Lincoln Chaffee of Rhode Island is gone, Arlen Specter of Pennsylvania is gone, but Olympia Snowe and Susan Collins, the two Senators from Maine, are still in the Republican Party and are constantly being attacked for being RINOs (Republicans In Name Only). Rush "Chickenhawk" Limbum, the leader of the Republican Party, has denounced Colin Powell, Senator John McCain and Senator McCain's daughter as RINOS. I've found another RINO. Here is a quote from him: quote: A lot of so-called conservatives today don't know what the word means. They think I've turned liberal because I believe a woman has a right to an abortion. That's a decision that's up to the pregnant woman, not up to the pope or some do-gooders on the religious right. It's not a conservative issue at all. A Republican that is pro-choice? Unthinkable! He's obviously a RINO and needs to be expelled from the Republican Party rolls! His name - Barry Goldwater. Granted it would be a posthumous purge, since Goldwater is dead - but aren't the Republicans people who stand on their principles? Surely their principles cannot allow them to allow Goldwater to be considered a Republican anymore.

content: It's easier to show this as drawing then to discribe it but I'm going to try. Imagine a left to right scale or meter. On the far left end is dictatorship. On the far right end is anarchy. This scale is the United States of America. On this scale is a floating bar. When the Articles of Confederation was signed, the bar was very close to the right end of the scale. When the Constitution was signed, the bar was moved to tap dead center, in perfect balance. To day the bar has moved far to close to the left end of the scale and is way to far from the center for my tastes. I forgot to mention the floating bar is a scale too. On the Top of it is the Republican party and on the bottom is the Democrat party. You see we're all so busy fighting over the up and down movement that we never seem to notice the leftward slide. Sadly, I think that's the plan of many of our "representatives" in the Government, both Republican and Democrat, in the first place. We all need to stop and look at all of our leaders, regardless of party, and determine if they are helping the bar slide left, or if they are trying to push it back right. BHO, Juan MexiCain and his kin, Specter, Snowe, Collins, Powell, Reid and many others are helping the bar slide left. That is not good for our Nation. As to Goldwater, he's right, every woman has the right to choose to kill their unborn or not. As a Roman Catholic, I'm a religious "do-gooder" that do everything within my power to convince a pregnant mother to not kill her child, but in the end, only she can make the choice. As conservative, I will tell you that the ability to make that choice is none of the Federal Government's concern. The "legality" of killing an unborn child is the States' purview to allow it or not. If mother so wished to kill her child and the State she lives in does not allow for abortion, then she would be free to travel to a State that does. Please do not confuse the terms: Republican, Conservative, and Religious they are NOT one in the same.

content: quote: Originally posted by shuman14: It's easier to show this as drawing then to discribe it but I'm going to try. Imagine a left to right scale or meter. On the far left end is dictatorship. On the far right end is anarchy. I would disagree. On the far left end is dictatorship - and on the far right end is also dictatorship. This scale is the United States of America. On this scale is a floating bar. When the Articles of Confederation was signed, the bar was very close to the right end of the scale. The Founding Fathers who pushed for a Constitution, such as Hamiliton and Madision, did so because they believed that the government under the Articles of Confederation was too close to being anarchy, with everybody going their own way and doing whatever was in their own self-interest and damn the other fellow. When the Constitution was signed, the bar was moved to tap dead center, in perfect balance. Today the bar has moved far too close to the left end of the scale and is way to far from the center for my tastes. I agree that it is way too far from the center for my taste as well - but I feel that over the past 8 years it had moved too far to the Right end of the bar, not to the Left. I forgot to mention the floating bar is a scale too. On the Top of it is the Republican party and on the bottom is the Democrat party. You see we're all so busy fighting over the up and down movement that we never seem to notice the leftward slide. Correction...the rightward slide, in my opinion Sadly, I think that's the plan of many of our "representatives" in the Government, both Republican and Democrat, in the first place. We all need to stop and look at all of our leaders, regardless of party, and determine if they are helping the bar slide left, or if they are trying to push it back right. I want it as close to the Center as it can get - not to the Right of Center or to the Left of Center. The problem is that all too many Americans feel that, if it is in the Center, it is a betrayal of their personal Rightward or Leftward inclinations. BHO, Juan MexiCain Spelling correction: "John McCain". Of course if the mispelling was intention, you're showing that your bias is Rightward, not toward the Center. and his kin, Specter, Snowe, Collins, Powell, Reid and many others are helping the bar slide left. That is not good for our Nation. And others would say that they are doing what they can to keep things in the Center - preventing the system from being too Right or Too Left. As to Goldwater, he's right, every woman has the right to choose to kill their unborn or not. As a Roman Catholic, I'm a religious "do-gooder" that do everything within my power to convince a pregnant mother to not kill her child, but in the end, only she can make the choice. As a conservative, I will tell you that the ability to make that choice is none of the Federal Government's concern. The "legality" of killing an unborn child is the States' purview to allow it or not. If a mother so wished to kill her child and the State she lives in does not allow for abortion, then she would be free to travel to a State that does. You are aware, are you not that by taking this position (which, by the way, you, I and the late Senator Goldwater share) those who identify themselves as Conservatives in 2009 will no longer accept you as being a "True Conservative"? The "True Conservative" positon of 2009 is that the States should decide - except when they decide differently than the anti-abortion Conservatives, at which time a federal law criminalizing abortion should be passed to supercede any state law that might legalize abortion. Just as when a state passes a law allowing same-sex marriage (such as Iowa), the "True Conservatives" of 2009 immediately call for a federal law to reverse the State of Iowa's law. State laws having precedence only applies, in their eyes, if the state law agrees with their "moral values", even if they do not reside in another state. Please do not confuse the terms: Republican, Conservative, and Religious they are NOT one in the same. I definitely agree. I am a follower of the teachings of Jesus Christ - and I am not a Republican nor a Conservative (at least, not a 2009 Conservative). Living through the ever-increasing invasion of people personal lives during the past 8 years of the Bush Administration has made me more and more a Libertarian as a reaction.

content: Rich, You're still talking right and left when you're really talking up and down. If you say it's dictatorship at both ends, then anarchy is the middle, but we know that can't be because the Constitution is the middle. Your arguement is that Bush is too up/left not center/right. BHO is down/left, which is still too far left. What I want is center/center, well a tiny bit up/center. We are way to close to the left. Maybe I should relable the bar with Monarchy on the top and Communism on the bottom to make it clearer. I don't want a divine emperor (up/left) or a people's premier (down/left). I want a constitutional president with alittle executive authority (just above dead center). Is that clearer?

content: Jim Jeffords of Vermont is gone, Lincoln Chaffee of Rhode Island is gone, Arlen Specter of Pennsylvania is gone, but Olympia Snowe and Susan Collins, the two Senators from Maine, are still in the Republican Party and are constantly being attacked for being RINOs (Republicans In Name Only). Rush "Chickenhawk" Limbum, the leader of the Republican Party, has denounced Colin Powell, Senator John McCain and Senator McCain's daughter as RINOS. I've found another RINO. Here is a quote from him: quote: A lot of so-called conservatives today don't know what the word means. They think I've turned liberal because I believe a woman has a right to an abortion. That's a decision that's up to the pregnant woman, not up to the pope or some do-gooders on the religious right. It's not a conservative issue at all. A Republican that is pro-choice? Unthinkable! He's obviously a RINO and needs to be expelled from the Republican Party rolls! His name - Barry Goldwater. Granted it would be a posthumous purge, since Goldwater is dead - but aren't the Republicans people who stand on their principles? Surely their principles cannot allow them to allow Goldwater to be considered a Republican anymore.

content: It's easier to show this as drawing then to discribe it but I'm going to try. Imagine a left to right scale or meter. On the far left end is dictatorship. On the far right end is anarchy. This scale is the United States of America. On this scale is a floating bar. When the Articles of Confederation was signed, the bar was very close to the right end of the scale. When the Constitution was signed, the bar was moved to tap dead center, in perfect balance. To day the bar has moved far to close to the left end of the scale and is way to far from the center for my tastes. I forgot to mention the floating bar is a scale too. On the Top of it is the Republican party and on the bottom is the Democrat party. You see we're all so busy fighting over the up and down movement that we never seem to notice the leftward slide. Sadly, I think that's the plan of many of our "representatives" in the Government, both Republican and Democrat, in the first place. We all need to stop and look at all of our leaders, regardless of party, and determine if they are helping the bar slide left, or if they are trying to push it back right. BHO, Juan MexiCain and his kin, Specter, Snowe, Collins, Powell, Reid and many others are helping the bar slide left. That is not good for our Nation. As to Goldwater, he's right, every woman has the right to choose to kill their unborn or not. As a Roman Catholic, I'm a religious "do-gooder" that do everything within my power to convince a pregnant mother to not kill her child, but in the end, only she can make the choice. As conservative, I will tell you that the ability to make that choice is none of the Federal Government's concern. The "legality" of killing an unborn child is the States' purview to allow it or not. If mother so wished to kill her child and the State she lives in does not allow for abortion, then she would be free to travel to a State that does. Please do not confuse the terms: Republican, Conservative, and Religious they are NOT one in the same.

content: quote: Originally posted by shuman14: It's easier to show this as drawing then to discribe it but I'm going to try. Imagine a left to right scale or meter. On the far left end is dictatorship. On the far right end is anarchy. I would disagree. On the far left end is dictatorship - and on the far right end is also dictatorship. This scale is the United States of America. On this scale is a floating bar. When the Articles of Confederation was signed, the bar was very close to the right end of the scale. The Founding Fathers who pushed for a Constitution, such as Hamiliton and Madision, did so because they believed that the government under the Articles of Confederation was too close to being anarchy, with everybody going their own way and doing whatever was in their own self-interest and damn the other fellow. When the Constitution was signed, the bar was moved to tap dead center, in perfect balance. Today the bar has moved far too close to the left end of the scale and is way to far from the center for my tastes. I agree that it is way too far from the center for my taste as well - but I feel that over the past 8 years it had moved too far to the Right end of the bar, not to the Left. I forgot to mention the floating bar is a scale too. On the Top of it is the Republican party and on the bottom is the Democrat party. You see we're all so busy fighting over the up and down movement that we never seem to notice the leftward slide. Correction...the rightward slide, in my opinion Sadly, I think that's the plan of many of our "representatives" in the Government, both Republican and Democrat, in the first place. We all need to stop and look at all of our leaders, regardless of party, and determine if they are helping the bar slide left, or if they are trying to push it back right. I want it as close to the Center as it can get - not to the Right of Center or to the Left of Center. The problem is that all too many Americans feel that, if it is in the Center, it is a betrayal of their personal Rightward or Leftward inclinations. BHO, Juan MexiCain Spelling correction: "John McCain". Of course if the mispelling was intention, you're showing that your bias is Rightward, not toward the Center. and his kin, Specter, Snowe, Collins, Powell, Reid and many others are helping the bar slide left. That is not good for our Nation. And others would say that they are doing what they can to keep things in the Center - preventing the system from being too Right or Too Left. As to Goldwater, he's right, every woman has the right to choose to kill their unborn or not. As a Roman Catholic, I'm a religious "do-gooder" that do everything within my power to convince a pregnant mother to not kill her child, but in the end, only she can make the choice. As a conservative, I will tell you that the ability to make that choice is none of the Federal Government's concern. The "legality" of killing an unborn child is the States' purview to allow it or not. If a mother so wished to kill her child and the State she lives in does not allow for abortion, then she would be free to travel to a State that does. You are aware, are you not that by taking this position (which, by the way, you, I and the late Senator Goldwater share) those who identify themselves as Conservatives in 2009 will no longer accept you as being a "True Conservative"? The "True Conservative" positon of 2009 is that the States should decide - except when they decide differently than the anti-abortion Conservatives, at which time a federal law criminalizing abortion should be passed to supercede any state law that might legalize abortion. Just as when a state passes a law allowing same-sex marriage (such as Iowa), the "True Conservatives" of 2009 immediately call for a federal law to reverse the State of Iowa's law. State laws having precedence only applies, in their eyes, if the state law agrees with their "moral values", even if they do not reside in another state. Please do not confuse the terms: Republican, Conservative, and Religious they are NOT one in the same. I definitely agree. I am a follower of the teachings of Jesus Christ - and I am not a Republican nor a Conservative (at least, not a 2009 Conservative). Living through the ever-increasing invasion of people personal lives during the past 8 years of the Bush Administration has made me more and more a Libertarian as a reaction.

The Founding Fathers who pushed for a Constitution, such as Hamiliton and Madision, did so because they believed that the government under the Articles of Confederation was too close to being anarchy, with everybody going their own way and doing whatever was in their own self-interest and damn the other fellow. When the Constitution was signed, the bar was moved to tap dead center, in perfect balance. Today the bar has moved far too close to the left end of the scale and is way to far from the center for my tastes. I agree that it is way too far from the center for my taste as well - but I feel that over the past 8 years it had moved too far to the Right end of the bar, not to the Left. I forgot to mention the floating bar is a scale too. On the Top of it is the Republican party and on the bottom is the Democrat party. You see we're all so busy fighting over the up and down movement that we never seem to notice the leftward slide. Correction...the rightward slide, in my opinion Sadly, I think that's the plan of many of our "representatives" in the Government, both Republican and Democrat, in the first place. We all need to stop and look at all of our leaders, regardless of party, and determine if they are helping the bar slide left, or if they are trying to push it back right. I want it as close to the Center as it can get - not to the Right of Center or to the Left of Center. The problem is that all too many Americans feel that, if it is in the Center, it is a betrayal of their personal Rightward or Leftward inclinations. BHO, Juan MexiCain Spelling correction: "John McCain". Of course if the mispelling was intention, you're showing that your bias is Rightward, not toward the Center. and his kin, Specter, Snowe, Collins, Powell, Reid and many others are helping the bar slide left. That is not good for our Nation. And others would say that they are doing what they can to keep things in the Center - preventing the system from being too Right or Too Left. As to Goldwater, he's right, every woman has the right to choose to kill their unborn or not. As a Roman Catholic, I'm a religious "do-gooder" that do everything within my power to convince a pregnant mother to not kill her child, but in the end, only she can make the choice. As a conservative, I will tell you that the ability to make that choice is none of the Federal Government's concern. The "legality" of killing an unborn child is the States' purview to allow it or not. If a mother so wished to kill her child and the State she lives in does not allow for abortion, then she would be free to travel to a State that does. You are aware, are you not that by taking this position (which, by the way, you, I and the late Senator Goldwater share) those who identify themselves as Conservatives in 2009 will no longer accept you as being a "True Conservative"? The "True Conservative" positon of 2009 is that the States should decide - except when they decide differently than the anti-abortion Conservatives, at which time a federal law criminalizing abortion should be passed to supercede any state law that might legalize abortion. Just as when a state passes a law allowing same-sex marriage (such as Iowa), the "True Conservatives" of 2009 immediately call for a federal law to reverse the State of Iowa's law. State laws having precedence only applies, in their eyes, if the state law agrees with their "moral values", even if they do not reside in another state. Please do not confuse the terms: Republican, Conservative, and Religious they are NOT one in the same. I definitely agree. I am a follower of the teachings of Jesus Christ - and I am not a Republican nor a Conservative (at least, not a 2009 Conservative). Living through the ever-increasing invasion of people personal lives during the past 8 years of the Bush Administration has made me more and more a Libertarian as a reaction.

No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz
